authors.name: Andrea R Daniel
authors.note: This protocol was adapted from work of Sean McCutcheon and colleagues in the Gersbach lab at Duke University.

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9q7do","text":"This protocol describes methods for CRISPR interference or activation screens identifying transcriptional and epigenetic regulators of human CD8+ T cell state. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: {"blocks":[{"key":"b26jl","text":"McCutcheon, S.R., Swartz, A.M., Brown, M.C. et al. Transcriptional and epigenetic regulators of human CD8+ T cell function identified through orthogonal CRISPR screens.Nat Genet (2023). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":168,"length":9},{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"b3v2t","text":"67. Langmead, B. \u0026 Salzberg, S. L. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. Nat. Methods 9, 357–359 (2012).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ifoe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a20ag","text":"68. Love, M. I., Huber, W. \u0026 Anders, S. Moderated estimation of fold change and dispersion for RNA-seq data with DESeq2. Genome Biol. 15, 550 (2014).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":121,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":134,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: TF and epi-modifier CRISPRi/a gRNA library construction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4o6i","text":"The TSSs for each TF and epi-modifier were extracted using CRISPick and 1,000-bp windows were constructed around each TSS (−500 to +500 bp).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: TF and epi-modifier CRISPRi/a gRNA library construction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6oamk","text":"After establishing an SaCas9 gRNA database with the strict PAM variant (NNGRRT) using guideScan66, the genomic windows were input into the guidescan_guidequery function to generate the gRNA library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":95,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"885F4BD8907F11EE9ABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR66"}}}}

steps.section: TF and epi-modifier CRISPRi/a gRNA library construction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cmlk4","text":"Any gRNA that aligned to another genomic site with fewer than four mismatches was removed from the library. The final gRNA library contained at least seven gRNAs targeting 120/121 target gene (there were no PBX2-targeting gRNAs) with an average of 16 gRNAs per gene. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":207,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: TF and epi-modifier CRISPRi/a gRNA library construction
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dp049","text":"A total of 120 NT gRNAs were included in the library for a total of 2,099 gRNAs (available in Supplementary Table 2, McCutcheon et al. Nature Genetics, 2023. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3665n","text":"Oligonucleotide pools containing variable gRNA sequences and constant regions for polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification were synthesized by Twist Bioscience.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k6tt","text":"gRNA amplicons were gel extracted, PCR purified and input into 20 μl Gibson reactions (5:1 molar ratio of insert to backbone) with 200 ng of Esp3I digested and 1 × solid-phase reversible immobilization (SPRI)-selected (Beckman Coulter) plasmid backbone. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52bav","text":"Gibson reactions were purified using ethanol precipitation and transformed into Lucigen’s Endura ElectroCompetent Cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3onjq","text":"Transformed cells were cultured overnight and plasmids were isolated using Qiagen Midi Kits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fatan","text":"Addgene: pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-dSaCas9-KRAB-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194278) and pLV hU6-gRNA hUbC-VP64-dSaCas9-VP64-T2A-Thy1.1 (Addgene 194279).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8e32m","text":"Plate 1.2 x 106 or 7 x 106 HEK293T cells in a 6 well plate or 10 cm dish in the afternoon with 2 mL or 12 mL of complete opti-MEM (Opti-MEM‱ I Reduced Serum Medium supplemented with 1x  Glutamax, 5% FBS, 1 mM Sodium Pyruvate, and 1x MEM Non-Essential Amino Acids).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ifpv","text":"The next morning, transfect HEK293T cells with 0.5 μg pMD2.G, 1.5 μg psPAX2, and 0.5 μg transgene for 6 well plates or 3.25 μg pMD2.G, 9.75 μg psPAX2, and 4.3 μg transgene for 10 cm dishes using Lipofectamine 3000.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60j86","text":"Exchanged media 6 hours after transfection and collect and pool lentiviral supernatant at 24 hours and 48 hours after transfection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"343cp","text":"Centrifuged lentiviral supernatant at 600g for 10 min to remove cellular debris. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50evo","text":"Concentrate lentivirus to 50–100× the initial concentration using Lenti-X Concentrator (Takara Bio). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cpu2e","text":"Transduce T cells at 5–10% v/v of concentrated lentivirus at 24 h post-activation. For dual transduction experiments, T cells were serially transduced at 24 h and 48 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"36o7e","text":"CD8+CCR7+ T cells were sorted and transduced with either CRISPRi  or CRIPRa TF + epi-modifier gRNA libraries at a low MOI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":3,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":8,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"59b7q","text":"Cells were expanded for 10 days and then stained for Thy1.1 (a marker to identify transduced cells) and CCR7 (a marker associated with T cell state). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bcnce","text":"An SH800 FACS Cell Sorter (Sony Biotechnology) was used for cell sorting and analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6dfj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"elnd","text":"    
  Antibody
  Target
  Fluorophore/Sequence
  Clone
  Isotype
  Dilution
  Application
  Manufacturer
  Catalog #
  Notes
  
  CCR7
  FITC
  150503
  Mouse IgG2a
  1:100
  Flow cytometry
  BD Biosciences
  561271
  Stain at 37C
  
  Thy1.1
  PE
  OX-7
  Mouse IgG1, κ
  1:300
  Flow cytometry
  StemCell Technologies
  60024PE
  -
  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":337}],"data":{}},{"key":"39ug4","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","0_4":"","0_5":"","0_6":"","0_7":"","0_8":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","1_4":"","1_5":"","1_6":"","1_7":"","1_8":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","2_4":"","2_5":"","2_6":"","2_7":"","2_8":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[65,65,65,65,65,65,65,65,65],"data":[["Antibody
  Target","Fluorophore/Sequence","Clone","Isotype","Dilution","Application","Manufacturer","Catalog #","Notes"],["CCR7","FITC","150503","Mouse IgG2a","1:100","Flow cytometry","BD Biosciences","561271","Stain at 37C"],["Thy1.1","PE","OX-7","Mouse IgG1, κ","1:300","Flow cytometry","StemCell Technologies","60024PE","-"]],"guid":"8E4B22BE82FD493A9082FDE82C71A078","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["Antibody
  Target","Fluorophore/Sequence","Clone","Isotype","Dilution","Application","Manufacturer","Catalog #","Notes"],["CCR7","FITC","150503","Mouse IgG2a","1:100","Flow cytometry","BD Biosciences","561271","Stain at 37C"],["Thy1.1","PE","OX-7","Mouse IgG1, κ","1:300","Flow cytometry","StemCell Technologies","60024PE","-"]],"rowHeights":[]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clj1","text":"For antibody staining of Thy1.1 cells were collected, spun down at 300g for 5 min, resuspended in flow buffer (1× phosphate-buffered saline (PBS), 2 mM ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid and 0.5% bovine serum albumin) with the appropriate antibody dilutions and incubated for 30 min at 4 °C on a rocker. Antibody staining of CCR7 was carried out for 30 min at 37 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":70,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4cavs","text":"Cells were then washed with flow buffer, spun down at 300g for 5 min and resuspended in flow buffer for cell sorting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46rgg","text":"Transduced cells in the lower and upper 10% tails of CCR7 expression were sorted for subsequent gRNA library construction and sequencing. All replicates were maintained and sorted at a minimum of 300× coverage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jkc0","text":"Genomic DNA was isolated using Qiagen’s DNeasy Blood and Tissue Kit. Genomic DNA was split across 100 μl PCR reactions (25 cycles at 98 °C for 10 s, 60 °C for 30 s, and 72 °C for 20 s) with Q5 2× Master Mix and up to 1 μg of genomic DNA per reaction.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ct5fu","text":"PCRs were pooled together for each sample and purified using double-sided (SPRI)bead selection at 0.6× and 1.8×. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"80l7a","text":"Libraries were run on a High Sensitivity D1000 tape (Agilent) to confirm amplicon size and quantified using Qubit’s dsDNA High Sensitivity assay.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duj34","text":"Libraries were diluted to 2 nM, pooled together at equal volumes, and sequenced using Illumina’s MiSeq Reagent Kit v2 (50 cycles).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3mvb7","text":"Primers are available in Supplementary Table 5 of McCutcheon et al. Nature Genetics, 2023. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41588-023-01554-0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"236l4","text":"FASTQ files were aligned to custom indexes for each gRNA library (generated from the bowtie2-build function) using Bowtie 2 (ref. 67). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7002BAE9908211EE9ABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR67"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvuqi","text":"Counts for each gRNA were extracted and used for further analysis in R.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8n6o","text":"Individual gRNA enrichment was determined using the DESeq2 (ref. 68) package to compare gRNA abundance between groups for each screen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":2}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7D9AB4E8908211EE9ABC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41588-023-01554-0#ref-CR68"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"20dtp","text":"DESeq2 P values were empirically transformed to cumulative probabilities using a midpoint linear interpolation of the 120 NT gRNA P values between 0 and 1. This transformation aligns the data with the null hypothesis that NT gRNA P values have a uniform distribution between 0 and 1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":7,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":130,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":230,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d19eb","text":"Within each gene, transformed P values were aggregated using a modified robust rank aggregation method to detect genes with nonuniform (non-null) gRNA P values. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":151,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dv269","text":"A gene-level P value was produced by comparison with 10 million gene-level null simulations of Pvalues randomly sampled from a uniform distribution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":95,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cj1r","text":"NT gRNAs were randomly grouped into NT control ‘genes’ (NTCs) and analyzed in the same way.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ei0k","text":"The number of gRNAs per NTC was sampled with replacement from the distribution of gRNAs per gene in the screen until all the NT gRNAs were used. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3qst","text":"Genes were selected as hits if their Benjamini–Hochberg false discovery rate (FDR) was less than 0.05. Gene-level aggregation was done in Python. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3uh82","text":"Two effect sizes were computed for each gene by averaging gRNAs’ unshrunk DESeq2 log2FoldChange within the gene, weighted by each gRNA’s transformed one-sided P value. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":84,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f12ll","text":"The larger (absolute value) effect size was chosen for each gene. Effect sizes were estimated in R. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: TF and epigenetic modifier CRISPRi/a screens in human T cells
title_html: TF and epigenetic modifier CRISPRi/a screens in human T cells
